xf:group.h:div:
Source details ?A source corresponds to the FRBR "manifestation" level. At this level, therefore, only information common to all copies of this source should be entered.
Information about individual copies (including their location) should be given at "item" level.
Manuscripts are somewhat special, being sources having only one item. Manuscripts, too, will have some information at source level and some (such as location) at item level, though the distinction is less clear than with printed sources.

xf:input.xf:label: Short description or title ?A heading identifying the source, e.g. "Printed score, first edition", "Autograph score, draft" or "Source A"

xf:select1.xf:label: Presentation ?Describes the source's basic mode of production or carrier (manuscript, print, sound storage medium, electronic resource).
Authority ?For use with manuscript sources. Describes the composer's degree of involvement in the production of the source. Thus, an arranger's own manuscript would not be classified an autograph.

Completeness ?Describes the completeness of the source: "Complete" indicates that this source is complete (this would also be true with a single solo violin part from an orchestral work, if it is not the remainder of an originally larger set of parts).
"Incomplete" indicates that one or more parts are missing from a set of parts.
"Excerpt" designates a section of a work, published or copied for stand-alone performance (like "Hanedansen" from Nielsen's "Maskarade").
"Fragment(s)" indicates that portions of the music are missing, e.g. a fragmentary sketch or a source from which pages are lost.

xf:input.xf:label: Term

h:fieldset.h:legend:
Identification ?Identifiers other than item-specific ones. For instance, RISM identifiers of prints can be entered here.
With manuscripts, RISM identifiers should be given at item level.
A source's shelf mark within an archive should not be entered here; place it in the "Location" section at item level instead.

xf:input.xf:label: List name ?The name of the catalogue or list identifying this specific item, e.g. "RISM"
No. ?The number identifying this particular source in the list, e.g. "B 1234"

h:fieldset.h:legend: Contributors ?Lists persons other than the composer or a scribe, contributing to the intellectual contents of this source, e.g. an arranger or editor; the composer is usually specified under "Identification" and need not be specified here. Scribes are identified below under "List of hands".

General source description ?Text describing or introducing to the source, its history, its significance etc.
Information on the source's physical appearance and condition should be given in the "physical description" area below.

h:div.h:span: External source descriptions ?Links to external resources (texts) about this particular source.

xf:input.xf:label: URI ?Link to the resource, e.g. "http://example.com/source_description.pdf"
Label ?A short, descriptive text which may serve as the link text, e.g. "The Carl Nielsen Edition's source description"

h:fieldset.h:legend:
Physical description ?Describes features shared by all copies of this source.
For details on a specific item (a specific copy, or a manuscript), use the "Items" section below.

xf:input.xf:label: Value ?The number of pages or folios, e.g. "48", "12 + 236", "XII + 36" + VIII"

Unit ?Usually "pages" or "folios"
Note: Please do not enter spaces in this field, as this is a so-called NMTOKEN type field. Please use underscore _ instead.
Value ?Numbers describing the physical dimensions of the source given as height x width, e.g. "23.5x34"

Unit ?Unit of measurement, usually "cm"
Note: Please do not enter spaces in this field, as this is a so-called NMTOKEN type field. Please use underscore _ instead.

xf:textarea.xf:label: Physical medium ?Description of paper, number of staves on page, printing technique etc.

xf:input.xf:label: Plate no.

h:fieldset.h:legend: Title page ?Transcription of the source's title page. Multiple title pages may be added if necessary

xf:input.xf:label: Label ?Optional label overriding the default "Title page" label, e.g. "Secondary title page" or "title page after first fly leaf". Especially, a label should be given to if more than one title page is quoted.

h:fieldset.h:legend:
Publication ?Publication data (publisher, place and date).
If the source is a manuscript, the date and place of its creation may be entered here.

xf:input.xf:label: Publisher
Place

dcm:date-editor.xf:label: Date ?This field may be used for manuscript datings also.

h:fieldset.h:legend:
Relations ?Defines relations between this source and other sources, versions (FRBR: "expressions") of this work, other works etc.
Currently only two relations have a visible effect in MerMEId: the relation "is reproduction of" pointing to another source marks this source as being a reprint of the other source; the "is embodiment of" relation pointing to an expression (version) of the works is used to specify which particular version of the work is embodied by this source.
Depending on the encoding pratice of your project, relations may or may not be defined mutually, i.e. the opposite relation may be defined on the target.
The list is based on FRBR relations (see http://www.ifla.org/files/cataloguing/frbr/frbr_2008.pdf).
Components ?Descriptions of the individual parts that constitute a composite source

xf:input.xf:label: Label ?An optional label for this component, explaining the component's position in the source, e.g. "pp.3-4"
Title ?The component's title or a heading identifying this component, e.g. "First movement" or "Song No.1" or if describing the individual parts in a set of parts "Soprani" or "cor."

xf:case.h:span: Description ?A more detailed description of this component's contents.

Unit ?Usually "pages" or "folios"

Unit ?Unit of measurement, usually "cm"
